entry.title: Top 10 SAP Cloud ALM News October 2025
entry.content:
Welcome to our October edition of the Top 10 SAP Cloud ALM Features! As the autumn leaves fall, we're harvesting a fresh batch of enhancements designed to transform your SAP application lifecycle management experience

Let's explore how these new features can help you navigate your cloud journey with greater confidence and agility!

 

IMPLEMENTATION UPDATES

1. Enhanced Test Case Management in Solution Activities

When you call up the details for a solution activity in the Solution Activities list, you can now see information about any Test Cases that are assigned to it. As well as its title, you can also see its Preparation Status (In Preparation or Prepared) and its Variant if one exists. The icon in front of the title indicates whether the test case is automated or manual. Furthermore, after entering Edit mode, you can now also Assign and Unassign test cases for the selected solution activity directly within this list.  

Note

The name of the test case is an active link, allowing you to call it up in the Test Preparation app directly.

 

2. Efficiently Manage Process Hierarchy Node Assignments with Mass Edit Feature

You can now edit the process hierarchy node assignments for multiple solution process in a single action, using the existing Mass Edit button in the Processes app. This can be useful if you need to make multiple changes at once based on Country/Region assignments, for instance.  You can edit the process hierarchy node assignments in both display mode and Edit Scope mode by selecting one or more solution processes and choosing Mass Edit.

The following choices are possible:   

  • < Keep Values >: This default value leaves current assignments unchanged. 
  • < Clear Values >: Removes all existing process hierarchy node assignments from the selected entries, apart from those that were assigned in Process Authoring.
  • < Assign Process Hierarchy Nodes >: Allows users to search for and select one or more process hierarchy nodes to assign to the current selection. Note that all previous node assignments are retained. 
  • < Unassign Process Hierarchy Nodes >: Allows users to search for and select one or more process hierarchy nodes to unassign from the current selection. Note that you cannot unassign nodes that were assigned in Process Authoring.   

Note

  • The entries made here are also applied to solution processes that are not currently scoped or have never been scoped before.
  • Also note that for performance reasons, only the first 100 entries are currently mass edited regardless of how many rows are selected. This may be particularly relevant for users using the Edit Scope function.

 

3. Process Hierarchy Node Filter Enriches Requirement Traceability

The new Process Hierarchy Node filter in the Requirement Traceability app elevates the capabilities of business analysts and solution architects, allowing them to filter requirements based on their assigned process hierarchy nodes. This feature streamlines the tracing and analysis of requirements relevant to specific business processes, equipping users with better tools to manage process-specific documentation efficiently.

 

4. Streamlined Library Management with Spreadsheet Upload

Enhance your workflow efficiency by importing Development and Interface elements through our new spreadsheet upload feature. We've added two purpose-built templates to guide you through this mass import process, making it easier to organize your libraries more efficiently.

 

5. New Document History Feature

The document history feature tracks all modifications made to documents throughout their lifecycle. This comprehensive change history becomes accessible as soon as a document transitions from draft status for the first time. Users can easily monitor document evolution, review specific changes, and export the complete history for detailed analysis or reporting purposes.

Note

Documents only have a history starting from the release of this feature. Changes made before this release don't appear.

 

6. Reset Test Actions During Test Execution

While running a manual test case, you can now clear a test action's status and return it to its starting point. This works even after you've already saved the test case. Don't worry - any defects you've logged or comments you've added will stay connected to that step.

 

 

OPERATIONS UPDATES

7. Design Your Own Business Process Monitoring Structures

Beyond the standard out-of-the-box processes in business process monitoring, you can now design and implement custom processes tailored specifically to your organization's unique workflows. This enhancement allows you to accurately model and track business processes that reflect how your company actually operates.

For comprehensive guidance on implementing this feature, visit the Creating Custom Processes documentation on the SAP Help Portal.

 

8. New Download Options for Job and Automation Management

The Monitoring page now offers expanded download capabilities to provide you with deeper insights into your jobs and automations. Beyond the previous functionality that only allowed downloading jobs, you can now access detailed execution data across your selected scope.

When you select the  Download option, you'll have three choices:

  • Download Jobs
  • Download Job Executions
  • Download Job Step Executions

These enhanced options give you greater visibility into execution details and step-level information, making it easier to track, analyze, and troubleshoot your automated workflows.

 

9. Configuration & Security Analysis Expands with New Validation Capabilities

The Configuration & Security Analysis app now has validation capabilities that lets you run compliance checks on your configuration items and gives you a compliance score based on the results. This lets you assess the compliance of your services and systems with the product’s security recommendations.  The capabilities are available in a new app called Configuration & Security Analysis - Validation app. You can access it by choosing the Configuration & Security Analysis - Validation tile from the SAP Cloud ALM Launchpad or by choosing  Validation from the left navigation.  For more information, refer to Validation.

 

10. Notification Enhancements for Processor Assignment Changes

You can now receive timely notifications - both via email and within the application - whenever a processor is assigned to or unassigned from an alert. This feature keeps you informed of important workflow changes and improves team coordination.

To receive email notifications, you must first enable the Alert and Event Management: Alerts Assigned or Unassigned option in your notification preferences. Simply navigate to the Me area, then go to Settings > Notifications and ensure this option is selected.

The enhanced notifications include:

  • Direct links to specific alerts when processor assignments change
  • Convenient access to the Alert List page showing all alerts assigned to you (particularly useful when multiple alerts are assigned using the Select All option)

For additional information about notification capabilities, please refer to our In-app Notifications documentation.

---------------------------------------------------

For a deeper understanding of these features and how to leverage them effectively in your organization, visit the SAP Help Portal for comprehensive documentation and best practices.

Remember, your success is our success. Let's continue this transformation journey together with SAP Cloud ALM!🚀

entry.title: SAP业务数据云BDC中的Intelligent Application智能应用概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

SAP业务数据云BDC中的Intelligent Application智能应用是什么？

Intelligent Application是以SaaS形式呈现的一份实时报表，是SAP业务数据云(BDC)中的核心分析组件，扮演着企业"决策助手"的角色。它将预构建的数据管道，数据模型、分析模型和可视化仪表板统一在一个完全托管的SaaS模式的解决方案中，确保企业能够快速获得可行动的Insight 。

 

 

SAP业务数据云BDC中的Data Products数据产品是什么？

是经过策划的、可复用的，业务就绪的数据模型，BDC内提供大量预置Data Products,一方面提供给Intelligent Application使用，一方面也提供给用户基于预置Data Products自行定制属于自己的Data Products，同时用户还可以从零开始搭建自己的Data Products

 

 

SAP开发Intelligent Application的目的是什么？

解决现代企业面临的分析实施复杂性和价值实现缓慢的挑战。传统方式下，企业需要投入大量资源来构建数据管道、创建模型和开发仪表板，而Intelligent Application通过预构建的完整解决方案，让企业能够专注于业务价值而非技术实施。

Intelligent Application呈现的效果是由BDC中各个组件协同工作达成的：基于SAP Datasphere的数据集成与建模能力，通过SAP Analytics Cloud提供可视化展现，并与S/4HANA等业务系统深度集成，最后以SaaS形式的报表呈现给用户。

 

 

Intelligent Application可以用来干什么？

智能应用就像企业的"即插即用商业智能中心"，提供开箱即用的分析解决方案，以最典型的一键部署

场景举例，在用户选择好目标报表，点击部署后：

1. 自动搭建数据管道

系统自动创建从源系统到分析层的完整数据管道，无需手动配置；数据管道自动执行数据提取、转换和加载工作，同时提供实时增量数据同步，确保报表持续基于最新业务数据

2.自动搭建数据模型

系统自动基于预置的Data Products将业务应用集成过来的数据建立数据模型

3. 自动搭建报表

系统自动基于预置的报表将数据模型内的数据转化为Insight

这里的报表是基于行业最佳实践设计的，包含大量分析模型和KPI指标，同时支持跨业务线的综合分析，如财务、销售、采购等领域的统一视图

4. 智能洞察和预测

报表还天然集成了AI模型，提供预测性分析和异常检测，同样以报表的形式展现

用户还可以将所有预置内容复制一份之后进行定制化，同时还可以结合SAP Databricks增强高级分析能力

 

 

Intelligent Application和市面上常见的分析解决方案有什么区别？

1. 完全托管的端到端解决方案：SAP提供从数据集成到可视化展现的完整解决方案，由行业专家预先构

建和维护，一键即可获取实时报表

2. 基于BTP的平台优势：作为SAP业务技术平台的原生服务，智能应用享受平台级的安全、监控和治理能力。这就像住在配套完善的智能社区，所有基础设施都由专业团队管理维护

3. 与SAP生态的完美结合

  • 深度集成：与SAP S/4HANA、SuccessFactors等SAP产品原生集成，保持原始数据不丢失，业务语义不错乱
  • 统一体验：共享SAP Fiori设计语言和操作习惯
  • 持续更新：SAP负责内容的维护、更新和功能增强

相比其他分析平台需要大量定制开发和维护工作，智能应用为SAP客户提供了"开箱即用"的分析能力，

特别适合希望快速获得业务价值的企业环境

 

 

Intelligent Application该怎么用呢？

主要步骤包括：

1. 环境准备和权限配置 获取SAP BDC订阅，在BDC Cockpit中配置用户权限和系统连接

2. 一键安装智能应用 从BDC Cockpit的应用目录中选择所需的智能应用，点击部署后，系统自动部署数据管道，数据存储，数据产品、分析模型和仪表板等全套组件

3. 开始分析：通过SAP Analytics Cloud访问Intelligent Application报表
整个过程采用自助式操作，业务用户通过直观的界面就能获得专业的分析洞察，大大缩短了从部署到价值实现的时间，让每个管理者都能立即拥有数据驱动的决策支持
4.定制化：根据业务需求，复制预置内容后执行定制化，添加个性化视图

 

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Re: In S4 Hana Public Cloud there is only two control key...
entry.content:
Hello @AbhijitGoswami 

 

Thank you for your question.

The following references will provide you with more details.

Maintenance Order Types, Processing a Maintenance Order, S/4 HANA Procurement Lean Service

Service Procurement

Blog: SAP future strategy around Scope Items BH1, BH2 & BJ2 in Private Cloud Edition

           New Phase Model for the Maintenance Processes in S/4HANA Cloud

To summarise, in public cloud, the keys you mentioned are used in on-premise to automatically trigger purchase requisitions with item category D for external services does not exist due to the clean-core principle. Instead, SAP delivers two predefined public cloud control YBM1 (internal processing No PR generated) & YBM2 (External processing PR generated for (goods item Category N)) keys. This confirms what you mentioned that YBM2 creates a PR but not item category D, therefore SES-based service lines are now handled differently in the cloud model.

Alternatively, SAP recommends to:

  • Use YBM2 system for standard external service operations which creates PR with Lean Service Item.
  • Use Direct Service PO to skip automatic PR by creating PO manually with reference to Cost Center.
  • You can also use Side-by-Side BTP Extension if your business must replicate PMO3

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Order combination flag ignored in STO delivery creation (S/4 Public edition)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

We're facing the issue that the "Order combination" tickbox is ignored when creating deliveries for stock transfer PO's, although the flag is active in the STO line items. A function that has worked in older SAP versions without any issues, but doesn't seem to work in S/4 Public Edition. The suggestion was made to investigate the usage of BADI "LE_SHP_SUPPRESS_DEL_SPLIT"(Suppress Delivery Split), but that BADI only considers Sales order items (VBELN_VA), thus no Stock Transfer items.

The default delivery splitting criteria are all identical in the STO's we're shipping:

  • Shipping Point
  • Ship-to Party
  • Route
  • Shipping Conditions
  • Delivery Priority

Also, symptoms as described in note 3310234 - Delivery split is issued during replenishment delivery creation based on STO - SAP for Me are not applicable in our case. So, why are deliveries still created per STO in S/4HANA? Any suggestions/advice is welcome to resolve this issue.

Regards,
Corné

entry.title: Environment, Health, and Safety in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected in close collaboration with our product management teams.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025

 

These are the topics that are covered:

Environment Management

Emission Management:

  • A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

  • Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

  • Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Waste Management:

  • Integration of waste management and purchasing processes

  • Waste management: integration with inventory management

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Incident Management Reporting:

  • Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning using tasks created from incidents

Management of Change Processes:

  • EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

 

 

Environment Management 

Emission Management:

A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

Business Background
The Environment Management Overview page offers businesses a streamlined platform to gain insights into their environmental management activities. Managers can easily monitor performance focusing on key data issues like exceedances, warnings, and missing data collected over the past six months. This enables them to quickly identify areas needing attention and make informed decisions, ensuring alignment with compliance standards and supporting sustainability goals.

Key Features
Users can customize their SAP Fiori launchpad homepage to suit their needs, enhancing decision-making and data monitoring efficiency. The overview page allows managers to quickly access critical environmental data, facilitating prompt action to meet compliance requirements.

Image#1: Environment Management Overview

 

Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

Business Background

In EHS Management, leveraging standard analytical content is essential for improving data-driven decision-making. By adapting existing CDS views, organizations can enhance the SAP EHS Management's environment management component. This enables thorough analysis of compliance data through SAP Analytics Cloud integration, allowing access to real-time data. Consequently, businesses can efficiently monitor tasks, track trends, and address environmental issues, helping managers maintain compliance and advance sustainability efforts.


Key Features
The innovation provides a live connection to the environment management system for immediate compliance data access, accelerating the transition from insight to action in daily operations. It also streamlines the experience for environmental managers by standardizing dashboard content, such as task overviews and trend analysis, aiding in efficient compliance management.

Image#2: Compliance Overview

 

Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Business Background

Companies operating within the European Union are subject to stringent environmental regulations, including the mandatory reporting of pollutant releases to public databases like the European Pollutant Release and Transfer Register (E-PRTR). Compiling this data accurately from various sources and formatting it according to specific regulatory requirements is a complex task with significant risk for non-compliance. This new feature directly addresses this compliance challenge by helping to automate the preparation of E-PRTR report files. The system gathers the required data on air emissions, wastewater pollutants, and off-site waste transfers and can generate an initial XML report compliant with EU regulatory standards, significantly reducing manual effort.

Key Features

This feature supports the preparation and reporting of toxic chemical release data for regulations such as the EU-PRTR. It enables the generation of an initial version of the required XML report based on collected environmental data.

Image#3: PRTR Facility Report

 

Waste Management:

Integration of waste management and purchasing processes

Business Background

Effective waste management is not just an environmental obligation but also a complex logistical and financial process involving service procurement and timely payments. A lack of integration between environmental management and procurement systems can lead to payment delays, inefficient service acquisition, and poor financial oversight of disposal costs. This new innovation introduces a system that establishes a direct connection between the purchase order, the disposal channel, and the waste transportation document, enhancing the integration of waste management with purchasing processes.



Key Features

This innovation integrates waste management with other logistics processes like supply chain management and procure-to-pay. As part of this new innovation, it is now possible to link one or multiple existing purchase orders, enhancing the integration and efficiency of procurement processes.

Image #4: Manage Waste Disposal Channels

 

Image#5: Hazardous Waste Disposal Channel

 

Image#6: My Waste Transportation Document

 

Waste management: integration with inventory management

Business Background

For organizations that handle significant quantities of waste, managing on-site storage is a critical operational challenge. Knowing the exact location and inventory levels of different waste materials is essential for optimizing storage space, ensuring safe handling, and planning timely disposal shipments. Without a clear view of waste inventory, companies risk inefficient space utilization and potential compliance issues. To provide this much-needed visibility, waste management in SAP S/4HANA is now further integrated with Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), allowing for the precise tracking of waste inventory within the warehouse and enabling more efficient on-site storage and better shipment planning.

Key Features

This feature enables the tracking of the inventory of stored waste through deeper integration into Extended Warehouse Management. This provides organizations with greater insights into the specific amounts and storage locations of waste on-site.

 

Image#7: Manage Waste Transfer Requests

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Business Background

Maintaining employee health and well-being is a cornerstone of corporate responsibility and operational stability. Organizations require a systematic method to manage occupational health programs, from initial risk assessment to ongoing medical surveillance. A disjointed approach can lead to compliance gaps, increased health risks for employees, and significant administrative inefficiencies. This innovation addresses these challenges by providing a structured, integrated framework within SAP S/4HANA. It allows EHS managers and HR professionals to proactively manage employee health based on identified workplace risks, ensuring the right personnel receive the right medical attention at the right time and simplifying compliance management.

Key Features

This feature leverages a central repository to track the occupational health history and related case management for employees. It also drives a risk-based occupational health process with deep integration back to central HR data for comprehensive visibility.

Image#8: Edit Medical Service

Incident Management Reporting:

Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Business Background

Following a workplace incident, a critical part of the resolution process is ensuring that employees receive follow-up training to prevent a recurrence. Manually assigning and tracking this training across different systems is often time-consuming and prone to error, which can delay crucial learning and compromise safety compliance. This enhancement streamlines the post-incident workflow by directly integrating incident management in SAP S/4HANA with SAP SuccessFactors Learning. When an investigation identifies a need for additional training, a task can be created to assign specific learning items to relevant employees automatically, ensuring a more responsive and effective safety culture.

Key Features

You can now assign learning content from SAP SuccessFactors Learning directly to employees via tasks created from incidents. The system automatically checks for the completion of these learning items and can complete the associated task, increasing transparency and efficiency.

 

Image#9: Assignment of Learning Items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

 

Management of Change Processes:

EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

Business Background
To effectively manage change, it is critical to know precisely where the change is taking place, especially from an EHS perspective. Previously, linking change requests to a specific EHS-relevant location, such as a work center or storage area, was not possible, which limited the ability to search for and analyze all changes affecting a particular site. This made it challenging to ensure full interoperability between Management of Change and other EHS processes.

Key Features
You can now use the EHS location as a primary reference object within a change request, creating a direct and unambiguous link to a physical area. This enhancement significantly improves interoperability across the EHS solution area and enables more powerful search capabilities. Teams can now quickly and accurately find all change requests associated with a specific EHS location, enabling better oversight, more precise analysis, and a more integrated approach to managing site-specific changes.

 


Image#10: EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities



More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani


For more information on SAP Cloud ERP Private, check out the following links:

  • Collection blog for Environment, Health, and Safety

  • SAP Cloud ERP Private page

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Community

  • Inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud

  • Best practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

  • Help Portal Product Page 

  • What's New | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: What's New in 2511 - Release Navigator for Spend Management
entry.content:
We're thrilled to announce the upcoming innovations for our 2511 Release! Our dedicated team has been working tirelessly to ensure you stay ahead with the latest enhancements. Below you can access the Release Navigator for Spend Management and easily locate all essential resources for a successful release, feature highlights for the upcoming release, and ways to connect to stay up to date!

Over the coming months, we'll be revamping and enriching our related content to mirror the newest advancements. Currently users can still access Business Network via the Release Navigator for Spend Management, you will be redirected to the Release Navigator for Supply Chain Management. As this journey continues, SAP Business Network content will begin to migrate from Spend Management communications to Supply Chain Management communications and portals! Dive into the 2511 release details below. 

Here are feature Highlights for the 2511 release for SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network. Make sure to read through the blogs to learn more about these features and ensure you are properly prepared for these updates.

  • Accelerated Release Cycle for SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway for spend management and SAP Business Network Add-On 1.0 for SAP S/4HANA and SAP ECC (BPI-596)
  • AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk (SRISK-1848)
  • AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Contracts (SCONTR-1279)
  • Use of Spend Data for AI Recommendations in Category Segmentation (ARBCATA-504)
  • New Transactional Use Cases for Approvals and Navigational Use Cases for AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP-2288)
  • Spend Analysis Benchmarks — Company vs Industry Performance (ANALYSIS-1324)

Follow the Spend Management and Business Network and ReadinessS@Scale community tags, and Ryan Russman to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

The 2511 release will incorporate release content updates only. With the migration of SAP Business Network to Supply Chain Management, the Release Navigator for Spend Management will continue to publish content updates but may delay UX updates to help minimize disruption to customers and partners.

Support.SAP.com – Release Ready page 

SAP Activate – Roadmap Viewer  

SAP Enterprise Support Value Map - SAP Enterprise Support Value Map for Spend Management and Business Network

Making Your Impact

At SAP, we greatly appreciate your input and suggestions. You are invited to submit feedback and suggest topics to be covered through our Topic Request & Feedback Survey. This survey provides you with an opportunity to provide insights on your experience with the release navigator for Spend Management and Business Network, as well as suggestions on how we can further enhance your release experience. Additionally, we encourage you to share your feedback, thoughts, or questions in the comment section below.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone in Integrated Product Development: A Step-by-Step Setup Guide
entry.content:
Why SAP Build Work Zone for IPD?

In complex IPD environments, teams work with various applications, from CAD systems to PLM tools and collaboration platforms. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition provides a central access point for all enterprise applications and reduces complexity for end users. The platform enables the creation of role-based, personalized business sites with flexible content structures.

Prerequisites

Before starting the setup, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  • SAP BTP Subaccount: An active SAP Business Technology Platform subaccount with appropriate permissions
  • Administrator Rights: Subaccount administrator or corresponding roles for configuration
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services: Access to Identity Authentication Services (IAS) for user management

Step-by-Step Setup Guide

1. Start Booster for SAP Build Work Zone

Navigate to the "Boosters" section in your SAP BTP Cockpit and search for "SAP Build Work Zone". The booster automates the basic configuration steps for your subaccount.

2. Select Subaccount

Choose the appropriate subaccount where SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition should be set up.

3. Start your application "SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition"

4. Create and Name Website

5. Link Launchpad_Admin Role with Identity Services

For role management, navigate in the cockpit side panel to:

  • Security → Trust Configuration
  • Click on the tenant you created in SAP Cloud Identity Services

  • A screen opens on the right side - click on the "Attribute Mappings" tab and then "Edit"

  • Under the "Role Collection" column, select the Launchpad_Admin role from the dropdown list

  • Enter "Groups" as attribute and "Admin" as value. Click "+" to add the attributes and save

The mapping is complete. You can now access SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Create a Site

When you create a site, you'll be redirected to the Site Studio Site Settings screen. By enabling "Spaces and Pages – New Experience" view mode, you can create spaces and pages locally in dedicated editors.

  • Click "Edit" in the upper right corner of the Site Settings screen
  • Under "Display" select "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"

  • Go to Site Directory to view the site tile

Your site is empty.

General Process

The general process is structured in the following steps: Apps → Pages → Spaces → Roles → Users

Configure Apps

Click the Content Manager icon in the side panel to open the Content Manager. You'll see a list of content elements added to your subaccount.

  • Go to Content Explorer and select your content
  • Choose the channel for your content

  • Select the channel functionalities and add them to your content

  • After adding functionalities from various applications, add them to your own content

Create Pages

  • Create a page

  • Add a name for the page, description, header, and select relevant widgets

  • Create this for all other necessary applications for IPD

Create Spaces

1. First decide whether one or multiple spaces are necessary

Check your requirements:

  • Do all users have the same access rights?
  • Do you need different security levels?

→ One space with multiple pages is optimal in most cases. Multiple spaces mean exponentially higher administrative complexity.

a) Create one space
Content Manager → Create → Space

  • Add title: e.g., "IPD Workspace", add description
  • Assign pages to space: activate assignment status for all pages
  • Order by priority
  • Save

b) Create multiple spaces
Content Manager → Create → Space:

  • "Collaboration Space"
  • "Specification Management Space"

2. Assign space to Everyone role
Content Manager → Everyone → Edit → Spaces Tab:

  • Activate assignment status for space and save

3. Complete site configuration
Site Directory → Site Settings → Edit:

  • View Mode: "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"
  • Confirm Everyone role

Role Assignments

1. Perform role assignments

a) Use Everyone role when:

  • All users should have access to IPD apps
  • You need a simple, quick solution
  • No differentiated permissions are required

Procedure:

  • Assign apps to Everyone role (activate Assignment Status)
  • Done - no further BTP role assignments needed

b) Create custom IPD role

  • Click Edit in Site Settings

  • In the Assignments area, add your created role ("+" symbol)

Additional Role Information

In addition to the setup steps described above, you can assign predefined roles to users for accessing specific applications within SAP Integrated Product Development. These role templates simplify permission management and ensure that users have access to the right tools and functionalities based on their responsibilities.

For more information, see the official SAP Help documentation: Role Templates for SAP Integrated Product Development .

  • Switch to BTP Cockpit
  • Navigate to Security → Users
  • Select your user
  • Click "Assign Role Collection"
  • Search for your created role and assign it

Conclusion

SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition proves to be a central solution for IPD challenges. The systematic implementation - from booster configuration through structured apps, pages, and spaces to thoughtful role management - creates an efficient work environment.

In the next blog, I will detail the integration of SAP Joule into the Work Zone and show how AI-powered functions can further increase productivity in IPD processes.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM中国区正式落地：以云端应用生命周期管理加速价值实现，助力云与混合场景的高效运维
entry.content:
我们非常高兴地向您宣布，SAP Cloud ALM目前已在中国区正式上线！

SAP Cloud ALM是一站式云原生ALM平台，覆盖从实施到运维的全生命周期。通过简化流程、提升透明度与协作、统一监控与可观测性及端到端追溯，它帮助您加速项目与升级交付，确保上线后稳定运行与持续优化，并满足治理与合规要求。本地部署/混合场景可与现有工具并行启用，无需“切换日”，在中国区获得更佳的网络与合规体验。

为什么选择SAP Cloud ALM

  • 立刻可用，提升运维效能：统一监控本地与云端关键业务流程、接口与作业，集中告警与仪表盘管理，显著降低系统停机与业务中断风险。支持与现有工具（如SAP Solution Manager）并行使用，无需“切换日”，平滑过渡零风险。
  • 项目升级即刻增效，敏捷交付：内置SAP最佳实践与加速器，覆盖需求管理、用户故事、测试缺陷、变更发布、切换计划及里程碑追踪。直接支撑EHP升级、S/4HANA转换及集成项目，显著缩短交付周期，提升项目透明度与质量。
  • 转型预演，资产高效复用：在本地部署/混合环境先行开展Fit-to-Standard与流程监控，沉淀规范化的需求、测试与监控资产；未来推进业务转型时，可复用项目结构、测试集与监控规则，显著降低转型成本与中断风险。
  • 统一治理，协同合规：构建从需求到生产的端到端追溯与KPI，集中化风险/问题管理与变更审批，支撑各个团队在同一平台协作并满足审计合规，提升项目透明度与可控性。
  • 渐进启用、成本友好：无需额外采购，随订阅/维护权益启用(详见使用权限）；与现有工具并行、按场景逐步采用，避免一次性替换带来的成本与风险。

客户可获益

  • 实施更高效：利用预配置内容、需求与故事管理、项目与任务编排、测试管理与缺陷跟踪，变更与发布管理，显著缩短项目交付时间。
  • 运维更稳定：实时监控关键业务流程与接口链路，自动告警与修复建议，减少停机与业务中断风险。
  • 决策更明智：内置仪表盘与分析报表，提供项目进度、质量指标与运行健康度的可视化洞察。
  • 团队更协同：统一平台链接业务、IT与合作伙伴，实现跨团队协作与知识沉淀。
  • 成本更可控：基于云交付、无需部署复杂工具，降低维护成本与初始投入，已涵盖在您的云订阅或维护合同中。

主要功能概览

  • 实施阶段
    • 项目与任务管理、最佳实践与加速器、Fit-to-Standard流程导航
    • 需求与用户故事管理、测试计划与执行、缺陷管理
    • 变更管理与发布管理
    • 基于流程的端到端追溯，可配置报表与里程碑跟踪
  • 运维阶段
    • 业务流程监控：端到端流程可视化与异常告警
    • 接口与集成监控：包括API、消息与中间件链路的健康与性能
    • 健康与作业监控：系统与应用关键指标、后台作业状态
    • 用户与性能监控：端到端真实用户体验，快速定位影响关键流程的性能与可用性问题
    • 告警与事件管理：规则、阈值、路由与通知
    • 分析与仪表盘：运行趋势、容量与稳定性分析
  • 混合场景支持
    • 统一监控云与本地部署系统，覆盖跨系统集成与数据流
    • 与SAP BTP及常用集成服务的联动，提升跨域可观测性
  • 扩展与集成
    • 开放API与内容扩展，适配企业特定流程与治理模型
    • 与SAP支持渠道和最佳实践知识库联动

使用权益与启用说明

  • 对于RISE with SAP与GROW with SAP客户：SAP Cloud ALM作为标准能力随套餐提供，无需额外采购。
  • 对于采用SAP云产品的客户：大多数SAP云订阅均包含Cloud ALM使用权益，可直接申请启用。
  • 对于混合与本地部署场景：可在现有支持合同范围内启用相应的监控与运维功能，具体覆盖与可用性以您的合同与系统版本为准。
  • 启用步骤建议
    • 单击此处快速申请您的SAP Cloud ALM租户
    • 只需几个基本设置步骤完成初始化配置

重要说明: 功能覆盖、数据托管位置与启用路径可能因您的合同类型、系统版本与地区合规要求而有所差异。具体请以SAP官方条款与实施顾问建议为准。

我们也将通过中文线上研讨会与您分享更多最新的SAP Cloud ALM内容，敬请期待。如需进一步了解SAP Cloud ALM相关信息，或有任何问题和反馈，请随时与我们联系。

SAP Cloud ALM 中国团队

entry.title: Re: Multistage intercompany sales is not available in SAP...
entry.content:
Good day @andrj111 

Thank you for your question.

The following references will provide you with more details.

Support for New Process: Multistage Intercompany Stock Transfer and Sales

Blog: Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

To summarise, in public cloud, the multistage advanced intercompany process where goods or sales pass-through multiple company codes/multiple legal entities in a single process is not supported. That is a private cloud or On-Premise functionality. There is no official roadmap announcement for its delivery in public cloud.

However, you can:

  • Use the standard single-level advanced intercompany sales/stock transfer process that are supported in public cloud.
  • You may also consider raising a request through Customer Influence Portal referencing your business case to help drive prioritisation of the functionality.

Alternatively, you may consider workarounds such as:

  1. Splitting the process into multiple single-level intercompany transfers across your entities.
  2. Use selective extensions or side-by-side intergration to bride the gap. 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Add Custom Field in Material Document Header Level
entry.content:
Hi vijaysharma3

Could you provide some more details about your use case? For example, where to do want to view the custom field and how do you want to use it?

I guess you are asking why is there only material document Item and not header? Could you use Journal Entry?

It does seem odd - perhaps no one has asked for it until now. I would recommend you submit an Influence Request also.

Are you a 3SL customer? If so, please consider Developer Extensibility:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/c9cf3615cc5f4f71ae29c39d08848a96.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

Another option to consider might be a Custom Business Object and link the Material Document Header as a key field. You could perhaps then create a custom CDS View. With that approach, you could reference it in BADIs for example.

Just a note about custom field capacity, it is unfortunately fixed: Please see this help article: Before Getting Started with Custom Fields 

"On average, you can create 100 fields per business context and you have 1000 characters available for all business contexts, except Coding Block. You can see the currently available space when adding a new custom field in the Business Context Capacity indicator. The amount of capacity that a field requires depends on its type and the defined length."

Thank you
Jerry

entry.title: Re: SAP Crystal Reports for Visual Studio SP37 print some...
entry.content: Only suggestion is as you suggested is to get a newer Printer. HP Print drivers had always been an issue with CR. For example when we used to support access using crpe32.dll and using DEVMode structure and the DMExtra values when getting the StructSize HP drivers always returned a zero value, so app had to specify that value, otherwise the app would crash. So it's not surprising those legacy printer drivers have issue... Maybe try an updated HP Printer driver to see if it recognises those old printers... Only option is to export the report to PDF and then print...

entry.title: Is it mandatory for Onboarding 2.0 (without EC) to have EC mini master?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have a client that has only RCM and ONB 1.0 modules implemented for SuccessFactors and their employee data are all in SAP ECC6.

We are going to implement ONB 2.0 for them but just wondering, since the "Manage Pending Hire" step will not be completed for the client (since they do not have EC), is it mandatory to create EC mini-master data for them?

We would like to explore ways to avoid sending data back from SAP ECC6 to SF to create the EC mini-master data (UDF).
